Understands role requirements to and works compliantly within relevant policies, procedures and approved risk limits

ae38e759-bdc7-4b5c-990a-a9ac67001dd1.description: This Risk Management (Financial Services) Credential assesses, validates and recognises the capability to manage risk capability in the workplace. Earners of this Credential demonstrated that they work with the business to develop, enhance and implement high level plans and risk management approaches, advise on current risks and implementation of the Risk Culture framework. This Credential is a custom framework designed exclusively for Westpac and offered in partnership with Deakin University.
ae38e759-bdc7-4b5c-990a-a9ac67001dd1.name: Risk Management (Financial Services) Advanced

badge_template_activities.title: Credential submissions are assessed by academic and industry practitioners with relevant experience.

The submission process is evidence based and successful achievement of a credential requires a portfolio of evidence, a written reflection and a video testimony showcasing the relevant skills and knowledge at the expected level.  The submission has addressed and demonstrated five out of the seven criteria listed below:
Evaluates and challenges the effectiveness of the Business; controls, monitoring and compliance, and monitors progress towards mitigating risks.
Reviews and challenges or may halt activities that materially affect Westpac’s risk position or operate outside frameworks or policies.

Analyses risks in the current environment and under stress and partners with the business to provide advisory and technical capability to effectively develop, maintain and enhance approaches to risk management.
Provides an enterprise-wide risk view, including the aggregated risk profile, to management and the Board.
Provides input and/or oversight of the group-wide approach to risk including the RMS, frameworks and policies, and the 3LoD model.
Provides insight on the Risk Culture framework and provides oversight and guidance to the Business on its implementation.
Review business strategy to ensure conformance with RMS and Group RAS

30d91494-e70f-40e3-92af-18e3fad1bb84.description: This Risk Management (Financial Services) Credential assesses, validates and recognises the capability to manage risk in the workplace. Earners of this Credential demonstrated that they review and assess risk; address regulatory requirements; provide implementation guidance on the Risk Culture Framework and implement strategy in line with risk appetite and action plans. This Credential is a custom framework designed exclusively for Westpac and is offered in partnership with Deakin University.
30d91494-e70f-40e3-92af-18e3fad1bb84.name: Risk Management (Financial Services) Leader

badge_template_activities.title: Credential submissions are assessed by academic and industry practitioners with relevant experience.

The submission process is evidence based and successful achievement of a credential requires a portfolio of evidence, a written reflection and a video testimony showcasing the relevant skills and knowledge at the expected level.  The submission has addressed and demonstrated five out of six criteria listed below:
Develops and implements strategy in line with Risk Appetite and the current levels of risk in the business and the new or emerging risks from the operating environment.
Takes an active role in setting risk appetite and ensures people are operating within approved risk appetite, including associated limits and authorities and meet our compliance obligations.
Assesses risks through in-depth monitoring of issues and incidents, control effectiveness, self-assurance activities, Key Risk and Control indicators, Assurance and Audit findings.

Makes rigorous, evidence-based risk decisions and improves Risk Profile by implementing action plans that effectively address regulatory requirements and root causes of issues to deliver risks back into appetite in a timely manner.
Reviews and assesses required capability (people, vendors and technology) and undertakes hiring or development to ensure priority capability and capacity uplift.
Role models and reinforces the foundations of Strong Risk Culture.
